---
title: CES-D vs RCADS
---

## CES-D vs RCADS

Harmony is the perfect tool to aid researchers in comparing the CES-D and RCADS scales for psychological evaluation. The CES-D (Center for Epidemiological Studies-Depression) and RCADS (Revised Children's Anxiety and Depression Scale) scales, both address various aspects of depressive and anxious symptoms.

## Compare the items in CES-D English and RCADS

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import CES-D and RCADS into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just CES-D into Harmony</a> - compare CES-D English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just RCADS into Harmony</a> - compare RCADS with other instruments



However, deriving meaningful insights could be challenging due to the different construction of items in the two scales. This is where Harmony steps in to aid researchers in the harmonisation process, allowing comparisons both within and across the two studies. Harmony uses advanced language processing and AI models to compare these two well-regarded psychological instruments, providing a percentage match between each item within CES-D and RCADS.


{{< card heading="Try Harmony" copy="Compare CES-D and RCADS " url="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app" >}}

{{< youtube cEZppTBj1NI >}}


This lessens the sometimes subjective nature of harmonisation, leading to more robust and valid comparisons. Harmony enhances the process by allowing researchers to directly import instruments in PDF format, eliminating tedious manual work and reducing errors. CES-D vs RCADS has never been this effortless. Harmony steps beyond linguistic borders by comparing items across multiple languages. This feature is quite essential when considering scales like CES-D and RCADS that are used worldwide. It ensures that linguistic differences do not come in the way of valuable research and allows for a globally inclusive analysis. If you are a researcher planning to compare CES-D vs RCADS, Harmony is the go-to tool for an efficient and comprehensive harmonisation process.
